contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "You do not need to stay near this mountain any longer" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: You have lived long enough in this hill country

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "turn" is an idiom for beginning action. Alternate translation: "Start again on your journey" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: Turn and take your journey

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "to carry you" means "to lead you" or "to govern you." Alternate translation: "It is too much for me to lead you by myself" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: I am not able to carry you myself alone

contextId.occurrenceNote: Turning is an idiom for beginning to obey a command. Alternate translation: "They left that place and went" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: They turned and went

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that they became afraid. Alternate translation: "made us very afraid" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: made our heart to melt

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "we kept going" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: we turned

contextId.occurrenceNote: begin to do something (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: rise up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "peoples in every land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: peoples that are under the whole sky

contextId.occurrenceNote: The words "lift up your eyes" are an idiom that means look. Alternate translation: "look" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: lift up your eyes

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. "The heart of" means "the middle of" or "the innermost part of," and "heaven" here refers to the sky. Alternate translation: "with a fire that went up to the sky" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: with fire to the heart of heaven

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Moses speaks of the stars as if they were small objects like food that Yahweh was dividing and giving out to the people groups. Alternate translation: "that Yahweh your God has put there to help all people groups" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: of which Yahweh your God has given a share all the peoples

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom that can be translated "people who belong only to him." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: a people of his own inheritance

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "you make Yahweh your God angry by doing what he says is evil" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: do what is evil in the sight of Yahweh your God, to provoke him to anger

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "listen" is an idiom that means to hear and obey. Also, "his voice" refers to Yahweh and emphasizes what he says. Alternate translation: "obey what he says" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: listen to his voice

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "remember it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: lay it on your heart

contextId.occurrenceNote: Use your language's idiom for two people who are close to each other and looking at each other when they are speaking to each other. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: face to face

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "You must remember" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: You will call to mind

contextId.occurrenceNote: If your language has an idiom that expresses a strong desire for something, you might want to use it here. Alternate translation: "I would be very happy if there were" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: Oh, that there were

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "a land where plenty of milk and honey flow" or "a land that is excellent for cattle and farming" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: a land flowing with milk and honey

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "you must always remember" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: will be in your heart

contextId.occurrenceNote: This idiom is a command and a blessing. If the Israelites obey Yahweh, they will receive blessings from Yahweh. Alternate translation: "Do what Yahweh says is right and good" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: You will do what is right and good in the sight of Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "that live on the earth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: that are on the face of the earth

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "did not love you more than he loved others" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: did not set his love upon you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This idiom means "repays them quickly and openly so that they know God has punished them." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: repays those who hate him to their face

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom for "your children." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: the fruit of your body

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom for "your crops." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: the fruit of your ground

contextId.occurrenceNote: The people should not be afraid even if they notice that the nations are stronger than they are. Alternate translation: "Even if you say in your heart" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: If you say in your heart

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "think" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: say in your heart

contextId.occurrenceNote: The people should not be afraid even if they notice that the nations are stronger than they are. Alternate translation: "even then do not be afraid" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: do not be afraid

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "you must remember" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: you will call to mind

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "die so you do not see them anymore" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: perish from your presence

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "enable you to defeat" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: give you victory over

contextId.occurrenceNote: The Israelites will completely destroy all the people from those nations, and in the future no one will remember them. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: you will make their name perish from under heaven

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "You must remember" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: You will call to mind

contextId.occurrenceNote: This idiom is a command. Alternate translation: "But remember" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: But you will call to mind

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. "because you always thought and desired the right things" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: the uprightness of your heart

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "Remember" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: Call to mind

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. "to offer the sacrifices that Yahweh requires" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: to stand before Yahweh to serve him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. See how you translated this in [Deuteronomy 6:3](../06/03.md). Alternate translation: "a land where plenty of milk and honey flow" or "a land that is excellent for cattle and farming" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: a land flowing with milk and honey

contextId.occurrenceNote: The idiom "with all your heart" means "completely" and "with ... soul" means "with all your being." These two phrases have similar meanings. See how you translated this in [Deuteronomy 4:29](../04/29.md). Alternate translation: "with all your being" or "with all your energy" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]])
contextId.glQuote: with all your heart and with all your soul

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "live on the earth" is an idiom that means as long as a person lives. Alternate translation: "for as long as you live" (See:[[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: all the days that you live on the earth

contextId.occurrenceNote: A bosom is a person's chest. This is a idiom that he holds close to his chest, which means he loves and cherishes her. Alternate translation: "wife you love" or "wife you dearly embrace" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: wife of your bosom

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a way of saying a person keeps something. Alternate translation: "must you keep" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: must stick in your hand

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "you must not demand it back" or "you must not require repayment" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: your hand must release

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "remember" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: call to mind

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "put the sickle to the standing grain" is a way of referring to the beginning of harvest time. Alternate translation: "from the time that you begin harvesting the grain" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: from the time you begin to put the sickle to the standing grain

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "remember" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: call to mind

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "strongly desires" or "really wants" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: desires with all his soul

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "the one who killed the other person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: the one who took a life

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "attacks him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: rises up against him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "give him over" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: turn him over

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "rise up" means to stand up in court and speak against someone to a judge. Alternate translation: "must not speak to the judges about something bad that a man did" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: must not rise up against a man

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "rise up" means to stand up in court and speak against someone to a judge. Alternate translation: "tells the judge that a man sinned in order to get the man in trouble" or "tells the judge that a man sinned, so the judge will punish him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: rises up against any man to testify against him of wrongdoing

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "stand before" is an idiom. It means to go to someone with authority and let him make a legal decision about a matter. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: stand before Yahweh, before the priests and the judges

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "another Israelite does not become afraid like he is afraid" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: his brother's heart does not melt like his own heart

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "until the people of the city lose the war" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: until it falls

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom for water that is moving. Alternate translation: "a stream" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: running water

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "do not treat your people Israel as if they are guilty of killing an innocent person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: do not put guilt for innocent bloodshed in the midst of your people Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "that son is the one who shows that the man can become the father of sons" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: that son is the beginning of his strength

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "act as if you do not see them" or "go away without doing anything" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: hide yourself from them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "you must not act as if you do not see that he has lost something" or "you must not go away without doing anything" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: you must not hide yourself

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "for his entire life" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: during all his days

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "He must never divorce her during his entire life" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: He may not send her away during all his days

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "may be a full member of the Israelite community" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: may enter the assembly of Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "may not be a full member of the Israelite community" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: may not belong to the assembly of Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "did not pay attention" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: would not listen

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "as long as you are a nation" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: during all your days

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "all that you do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: all that you put your hand to

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "The words you have spoken" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: That which has gone out from your lips

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom for "If a man kidnaps." It can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "If you find a man kidnapping" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: If a man is found kidnapping

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "Remember" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: Call to mind

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. The Israelites considered the new day as starting when the sun went down. Alternate translation: "you should pay the man on the same day he does the work" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: the sun must not go down on this unsettled matter

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "remember" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: call to mind

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "remember" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: call to mind

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "you may live for a long time" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: your days may be long

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom, and "Amalek" is a metonym for the Amelikite people. Alternate translation: "Remember what the Amalekites did to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-names]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: Call to mind what Amalek did to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "he will make you more important than" or "he will make you greater than" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: he will set you high above

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. See how you translated this in [Deuteronomy 6:3](../06/03.md). Alternate translation: "a land where plenty of milk and honey flow" or "a land that is excellent for cattle and farming" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: a land flowing with milk and honey

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "something a man has made" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: the work of the hands of a craftsman

contextId.occurrenceNote: These idioms for "your children, and your crops, and all your animals" form a merism for everything the Israelites valued. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-merism]])
contextId.glQuote: the fruit of your body, and the fruit of your ground, and the fruit of your beasts

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. The actual number could be more or less than seven. Alternate translation: "in many different directions" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: seven ways

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "in everything you do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: in all that you put your hand to

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. See how you translated these words in [Deuteronomy 28:4](../28/04.md). Alternate translation: "with children, animals, and crops" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: in the fruit of your body, in the fruit of your cattle, in the fruit of your ground

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom for "your children, your crops." See how you translated this in [Deuteronomy 28:4](../28/04.md). (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: the fruit of your body, the fruit of your ground

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "in everything you do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: in all that you put your hand to

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "in many different directions" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: seven ways

contextId.occurrenceNote: This idiom means foreigners will have more power, money, and honor than the Israelites. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: rise up above you higher and higher; you yourself will come down lower and lower

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "from places that you know nothing about" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: from the ends of the earth

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "He will make sure that you again suffer from the diseases of Egypt" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: He will bring on you again all the diseases of Egypt

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "the diseases will not stop, and no one will be able to heal you of them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: they will cling to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "Yahweh will cause you to be afraid, without hope, and sad" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: Yahweh will give you there a trembling heart, failing eyes, and a soul that mourns

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "You will not know whether you will live or die" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: Your life will hang in doubt before you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "because of the fear you are feeling" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: because of the fear in your hearts

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "enabled you to understand" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: given you a heart to know

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "congratulate himself" or "encourage himself" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: bless himself in his heart

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "even though I still refuse to obey Yahweh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: though I walk in the stubbornness of my heart

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "these things" refer to the blessings and curses described in chapters 28-29. The phrase "have come on you" is an idiom that means to happen. Alternate translation: "When all these things happen to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: When all these things have come on you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "remember them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: call them to mind

contextId.occurrenceNote: These three phrases are idioms for "in children ... in calves ... in crops." See how you translated these words in [Deuteronomy 28:4](../28/04.md). (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: in the fruit of your body ... in the fruit of your cattle ... in the fruit of your ground

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "I will not help them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: I will hide my face from them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "Make them memorize and sing it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: Put it in their mouths

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. "tell how good Yahweh is" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: proclaim the name of Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "Remember" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: Call to mind

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. "put the nations in the places where they would live." Similar words, "giving to you as an inheritance," appear in [Deuteronomy 4:21](../04/21.md). (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: gave the nations their inheritance

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. The apple of an eye refers to the dark part inside the eyeball that allows a person to see. This is a very important and sensitive part of the body. This means that the people of Israel are very important to God and something he protects. Alternate translation: "he protected him as something very valuable and precious" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: he guarded him as the apple of his eye

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. The word "him" refers to the people of Israel. Alternate translation: "Yahweh made them ride on high places of the land" or "Yahweh helped them take and occupy the land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: He made him ride on high places of the land

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "I will turn away from them" or "I will stop helping them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: I will hide my face from them

contextId.occurrenceNote: Something bad has happened to them. Alternate translation: "they are helpless" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: their foot slips

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "Pay attention to" or "Think about" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: Fix your mind on

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. Alternate translation: "fight against" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: rise up against

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom. It means Yahweh and Moses had a very close relationship. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: Yahweh knew face to face
